frameDefinitions: In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '
An Entity changes from a Prior_state to a Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
An Entity (generally food) is exposed to a Heat_source whose Temperature may also be specified.
An Entity ends up in a Final_category, Final_situation, or Final_quality which it was not in before.
In this frame the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. '' '
frameExamples: The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
Their offensive armament has <t>developed</t> from short range missiles to long-range ballistic weaponry in a relatively short period .
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
Bacon was <t>frying</t> in the pan, and a great heap of eggs already lay steaming on a plate.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location where the Progress occurs.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Entity</fen> (often a food item)  that absorbs heat.
The <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Entity</fen> that absorbs the heat.
This role identifies the object that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the heat absorption takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change, ending up in the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
The quality of the <fen>Entity</fen> after the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> ends up in after the change.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation after the change.
When the change occurs.
Where the change takes place.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
listRoleExamples: Advances <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
<fex>When</fex> did the X-wing progress beyond the drawing board?
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
<fex>Bacon</fex> frying in the pan and scenting the air
Five fat sausages were frying <fex>in the pan</fex>
Food was placed to sizzle <fex>on the barbecue </fex>.
<fex>Five minutes ago</fex>the eggs weren't boiling yet.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex> the meat sizzled in the oven and a big pan of potatoes stood on the hob
He never could understand how she ended up <fex>an evangelist</fex>.
My father got <fex>to where he did in the business</fex> through instinct and entrepreneurialism.
<fex>By 1945</fex> he had become uncertain of the advisability of anyone having such a weapon.
<fex>The bikes</fex> rusted from their former beauty.
